hero.title: Transientica: AudioLab
hero.subtitle: BEATBOX RHYTHM GAME
hero.description: ML-powered beatbox recognition for rhythm gaming

demo.title: What It Does
demo.description: Play rhythm games with your mouth. Beatbox kick/snare/hi-hat sounds, ML recognizes them in under 60ms. 82% accuracy.
demo.research: Uses spectral-flux to detect onsets, then SVM classifies the sound type. Fast enough to feel instant.

realtime.title: Real-time Recognition
realtime.desc: Under 60ms from sound to game response. Spectral flux finds the onset, SVM classifies it

ml.title: Personalized Training
ml.desc: Train it on your beatbox style. Works for different voices, different techniques

lowlatency.title: Low Latency Pipeline
lowlatency.desc: Python processes audio, sends to Unity via OSC. Fast enough for competitive rhythm games

challenge1.title: Getting Latency Under 50ms
challenge1.problem: First version had 180ms lag. Audio in, features, ML, network, game. Too slow.
challenge1.solution: Optimized pipeline. Smaller FFT window (512 samples, 11ms). Circular buffer kills I/O blocking. Lightweight SVM (2ms vs 15ms neural net). UDP for OSC. Got it to 45ms with 92% accuracy.

challenge2.title: Kick vs Snare
challenge2.problem: Kick and snare sound similar. Both have transients and noise. Lots of wrong guesses.
challenge2.solution: Added more features. Spectral centroid (kick lower, snare higher). Zero-crossing rate (snare has more highs). Envelope shape (kick sharp, snare sustained). Separate models for solo vs patterns. 78% to 92% accuracy.

challenge3.title: No Audio Dropouts
challenge3.problem: Heavy ML caused buffer underruns on weak CPUs. Clicks and missed sounds.
challenge3.solution: Separated audio and ML threads. Lock-free ringbuffer between them. Audio on high priority, never blocks. ML on worker thread. If ML takes too long, skip that frame. Better to miss one sound than drop audio.

hero.title: Transientica: AudioLab
hero.subtitle: GRA RYTMICZNA BEATBOX
hero.description: Rozpoznawanie beatboxu oparte na ML dla gier rytmicznych

demo.title: Wat het doet
demo.description: Speel ritmegames met je mond. Beatbox kick/snare/hi-hat geluiden, ML herkent ze in minder dan 60ms. 82% nauwkeurigheid.
demo.research: Gebruikt spectral-flux om onsets te detecteren, dan SVM classificeert het geluidstype. Snel genoeg om instant te voelen.

realtime.title: Realtime herkenning
realtime.desc: Onder 60ms van geluid naar game-reactie. Spectral flux vindt de onset, SVM classificeert

ml.title: Gepersonaliseerde training
ml.desc: Train het op jouw beatboxstijl. Werkt voor verschillende stemmen, verschillende technieken

lowlatency.title: Lage latentie pipeline
lowlatency.desc: Python verwerkt audio, stuurt naar Unity via OSC. Snel genoeg voor competitieve ritmegames

challenge1.title: Onder de 50ms latentie komen
challenge1.problem: Eerste versie had 180ms lag. Audio in, features, ML, netwerk, game. Te traag.
challenge1.solution: Pipeline geoptimaliseerd. Kleiner FFT-window (512 samples, 11ms). Circular buffer elimineert I/O-blocking. Lichtgewicht SVM (2ms vs 15ms neural net). UDP voor OSC. Kwam uit op 45ms met 92% nauwkeurigheid.

challenge2.title: Kick vs snare
challenge2.problem: Kick en snare klinken vergelijkbaar. Beide hebben transiÃ«nten en ruis. Veel verkeerde classificaties.
challenge2.solution: Meer features toegevoegd. Spectral centroid (kick lager, snare hoger). Zero-crossing rate (snare heeft meer highs). Envelope-vorm (kick scherp, snare sustained). Aparte modellen voor solo vs patronen. Van 78% naar 92% nauwkeurigheid.

challenge3.title: Geen audio-dropouts
challenge3.problem: Zware ML veroorzaakte buffer underruns op zwakke CPU's. Klikken en gemiste geluiden.
challenge3.solution: Audio en ML-threads gescheiden. Lock-free ringbuffer ertussen. Audio op hoge prioriteit, blokkeert nooit. ML op worker thread. Als ML te lang duurt, skip dat frame. Beter Ã©Ã©n geluid missen dan een audio-dropout.
